intro: Euphrasia × lepontica, commonly known as the leopard's bane, is a hybrid plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. The plant is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia × lepontica is typically found in rocky soils and is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
